title: Introduction
description: Genesis which means beginning. It tells the story of how the world began and how God created all things, including animals of different kind and human beings both male and female.Moses,the Prophet,and the leader of Israel was an author of Pentateuch.The first book is Genesis.He wrote Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy.All together known as Torah which means law.Bible doesn’t tell exactly when and where Genesis was written, but it was probably written by Moses during the years of Israelites encampment in the wilderness at Sinai.And it may be written to early Israelites after their Exodus from slavery in Egypt before they entered to the land of Canaan.

title: Introduction
description: The Gospel of Luke is consisting of 24 chapters and is written by Luke, a physician, and a Gentile.He was a close companion of the Apostle Paul in his missionary journey also remained with Paul during Paul’s imprisonment in Rome.When and where; Luke began writing his account on Jesus probably at Caesarea and finished it in Rome between AD 65 and 70.Luke was a Greek, a gentile, therefore, he has written his gospel in a way that gentiles (non-Jew) would easily understand.In addition to this gospel Luke also wrote the book of Acts. Luke was a physician, missionary (associated with Paul in his mission) and above all, a historian. He was very careful both in his gospel and in the book of Acts to give accurate historical details.Luke wrote this historical account on Jesus to Theophilus probably a Roman official to establish him in the faith in Jesus Christ. Theophilus was a believer and then the purpose of the book was edification of the saint.Luke presents Jesus as ‘Son of Man’ ‘Perfect man’ and the key words in this gospel is ‘Salvation’ and ‘Son of Man’.Key verses:   2 :15,  4 :18-19,  19:10 ,Key chapters: 1, 4, 15 & 19
